title: Sampler, 1759
medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation 
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation
inscribed: Sarah Plommer her work in the ninth year of her age 1759
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. Purchased Rockafeller sale 1962 Anderson Gallery Cat. #1303.
creditline: Gift of Myra and William H. Mathers
description: Urn of flowers in the center, a flowering vine border, male and female figures in corners, cupids and birds.
justification:
The embroidered samplers in the museum’s collection are some of the most outstanding examples of this type found anywhere in the world. With over 1,000 examples that range from the 17th through the early 20th century, the samplers originate from countries such as Germany, the Netherlands, France, Mexico, Great Britain, and the United States.
This sampler is part of an extraordinary gift of more than 40 samplers. The samplers span almost 200 years and are from countries such as England, Germany, Romania, Spain, Italy, Mexico, and the United States.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1759. Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation 
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation. Gift of Myra and William H. Mathers. 2003-14-1.
